subject: Availability of weather data
caption: Showing weather data arriving at the end of the reporting period;;;;;;;;Similar pattern of weather data at other FACT weather stations
description:
Weather data was being recorded at FSAH3 at the tail end of the reporting period. Although we haven't been tracking metrics for L?? channels until now, I believe these channels have been out for a long duration. A similar availability pattern of weather data was also observed at H4, H5, H6, and H7
UPDATE: These data are not available currently

subject: Cross talk at NVAR
caption: NV BHE;;;;NV BHN;;;;NV BHZ
description:
Two issues raised from cross talk flagged 2021-03-04 - IM.NV31..BHN:BHE.D and IM.NV31..BHN:BHE.D.
UPDATE: xTalk was not flagged for this reporting period, but will keep the ticket open in order to monitor.

subject: Elevated noise at single element
caption: Amplitude ratios consistently above 2 for the reporting period;;;;Noise spectra at the H1 element;;;;Noise spectra at the H3 element for comparison;;;;I58H1 with relatively high amplitudes;;;;I58H2 with lower amplitudes than H1;;;;H1/H2 comparison. Note elevated amplitude at H1 late on the 14th
description:
Sample RMS ratio is consistently above 2 for the entire reporting period. Noise appears elevated at the H1 element.

UPDATE: Element H1 flagged arrayRms threshold from 2021-03-01 to 2021-03-05. Waveform for this element has higher amplitudes.
UPDATE: H1 continues to be flagged.

subject: GUMO noise
caption: Likley a wind event seen on all channels;;;;High amplitdue threshold broken but spectra gerenally look normal;;;;Reasonable noise at GUMO for the reporting period
description:
New ticket for "real" noise at GUMO. High amplitdue threshold brokedn on 2021-03-04 for all channels as well as 2021-03-05 to 2021-03-06 for BH1.
UPDATE: Noise charateristics look good for GUMO for this week. Marking this as resolved.

subject: Gaps
caption: Comparison of IRIS-downloaded vs WATC-downloaded waveforms for ELK.BHZ showing gaps in WATC data but not in IRIS;;;;Daily number of gaps on BHZ. Similar numbers for all components;;;;WATC client;;;;IRIS client;;;;Continued gaps
description:
All broadband channels at US.ELK exhibit high numbers of gaps for the entire reporting period. The same data from the IRIS FDSN do not exhibit gaps. There appears to be a communication error at some point. Gaps continuing through the current reporting period.

UPDATE: Continue to experience gaps.

subject: Gaps and Outages
caption: Low availability beginning on 2021-02-25;;;;Large numbers of gaps beginning on 2021-02-25;;;;TKL gaps ;;;;TKL low availability;;;;No gaps for this reporting period
description:
Large numbers of gaps and low availability began on 2021-02-25. This is a known issue and is related to a failed switch in the system.

UPDATE: Gaps and low availability continue on all channels.
UPDATE: No gaps for this reporting period.

subject: Gaps at DLL
caption: DLL.01 ;;;;DLL.02;;;;DLL.03;;;;Few gaps on H1 element;;;;Low availability at H1;;;;Large numbers of gaps on elements H3-H6;;;;Low availability periods on all elements;;;;;;;;
description:
All elements of DLL experienced large numbers of gaps on 2021-01-12. Additionally, DLLH1 experienced large numbers of gaps on 2021-01-17.

UPDATE: Gaps and outages continue at DLL [1-3] HDF and DLL.02 LWS, LWD, LK0 week of 2021-02-15 to 2021-02-22 
UPDATE: Gaps continue at DLL. Particularly at elements H2 and H3, with fewer numbers of gaps at other elements.

UPDATE: Not flagged week of 2021-03-1! Will keep open to continue to monitor.
UPDATE: There were gaps and outages this week. All elements had low availability days, but elements 1 and 2 had fewer numbers of gaps.

subject: High amplitudes
caption: High amp I4 ;;;;High amp I5;;;;High amp I6;;;;Elevated noise on the 12th and 13th;;;;High frequency noise at I4 on the 13th;;;;Waveform at I4 showing what is likely wind-induced noise
description:
High amplitudes were flagged for FSAH4.I[4-6]. Likely a wind event?
These elements continue to be noisy into the current reporting period. Keeping the ticket open and changing the status to "In Progress".
UPDATE: While some noise continues at this station, the revised hiAmp threshold was not exceeded for the reporting period. Marking this ticket as resolved.
UPDATE: Re-opened this ticket as elements 4, 5, and 6th broke the hiAmp threshold on the 12th and 13th. This was a probable wind event.

subject: Low amplitude
caption: SHE flagged for low amp; spectra look unhealthy;;;;SHE low amplitude;;;;Spectra of horizontal components are low
description:
Low amplitudes flagged for entire week 2020-12-21 to 2020-12-27.

UPDATE: Low amplitudes for FSAH1.S1.SHE flagged for 2021-02-15 and 2021-02-20
UDATE: Opening this ticket back up. The SHE channel flagged for low amp again and the spectra do not look too healthy. Possible metadata issue. Will monitor.

UPDATE: Flagged again on 2021-03-07 for SHE and SHN
UPDATE: This issue persists and likely will until a metadata change is implemented.

subject: Malfunctioning weather station at FSAH2.M1
caption: Waveform showing digitizer noise from the met channels;;;;M1 waveforms with sensitivities removed. Not flagged.;;;;Very low number of unique values for the period indicating a dead sensor;;;;Very low rms for the reporting period indicating a dead sensor
description:
Continued dead channels for the met sensor at this station. 

Update: Not dead but continues to have issues. This was seen from manual inspection (quarg did not flag).

Update: This is being looked at by several folks.

Update: We are now computing metrics for weather channels and this problem was succesfully detected by quarg via 'flat' and 'lowRMS'.
Update: LWS and LWD channels remain dead

subject: Outages at QSPA
caption: Continued gaps BH1;;;;Continued gaps BH2;;;;;;;;Daily small numbers of gaps on all 3 components;;;;
description:
Gaps and outages for entire reporting period at QSPA BH?. Outages not symmetrical for all elements. Large numbers of gaps continue for all 3 components for this reporting period. Continue to see gaps

UDATE: This issue continues.
UPDATE: Gaps and outages continue, at least on the FDSN server
UPDATE: The same situation persists into this reporting period.

UPDATE: Not flagged week of 2021-03-01! Will keep open to monitor.
UPDATE: Small numbers of gaps persist for this reporting period. These may be expected telemetry outages.

subject: Transient Noise on Infrasound
caption: Elevated noise at FSAH2 on the 12th and 13th.;;;;High frequency noise on the 12th;;;;Waveform showing noise on the 12th at I5
description:
All elements were noisy enough to break the hiamp threshold on the 2020-11-30 and 2020-12-02.  This noise appears transient and is likely associated with wind events.
UPDATE: Re-opened this ticket as the 'hiAmp' threshold was broken by most elements on the 12th and 13th.

subject: Transient noise on PMSA broadband
caption: Noise spectra showing probable calibration pulses on BH1 component;;;;Raw waveform showing probable calibration pulses
description: The hiAmp threshold identified transient noise on all 3 componenets. Noise looks like calibration pulses.

subject: Transients at I52 infrasound
caption: Transients at I52;;;;Close-up of transient at H1;;;;Spectra at I52H1 showing transient
description: The arrayRMS metric flagged transient noise at the I52 infrasound network on the 14th. The highest amplitudes were on the H1 element, but are also visible on the other elements. The features look very much like mass recenters on seismic data - I am unable to interpret.
